    Introduction

    R6 class that creates b-splines.

    bspline.Rd

    Creates b-splines given some set of knot points, and then evaluates the splines given some set of coefficients for the splines. It has 3 arguments initialisation : f = BSpline(K, t_knot, m).

    Public fields

    t_knot

    Spline knot points.

    K

    Order of polynomial.

    m

    Spline coefficients (\(m = M \cdot D\)).

    x_mean

    If set, these will be used to scale the output (default to 0).

    x_std

    \(x_{out} = x_{std} \cdot (X \cdot m) + x_{mean}\)

    t_pp

    pp break points (size(t_pp) = length(t_knot) - 2*K + 1).

    C

    Piecewise polynomial coefficients (size(C) = [length(t_pp)-1, K]).

    Methods

    Public methods

    • bspline$new()

    • bspline$clone()

    Method new()

    Instantiate an object of the class bspline.

    Usage

    bspline$new(t_knot, K, m)

    Arguments

    t_knot

    Spline knot points.

    K

    Order of polynomial.

    m

    Spline coefficients (\(m = M \cdot D\)).

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    bspline$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
